intro: Haplopappus hypoleucus, commonly known as the slender pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, producing wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in arid regions and is adapted to survive in poor soil conditions.
